channel.title: New computer
channel.description:
is this any good,
[b]Processor[/b] Intel® Core™2 Quad Processor Q6600 (2.4GHz, 1066FSB, 8MB)
[b]Operating System[/b] Windows Vista Home Premium
[b]Memory[/b] 3GB (2 x 1GB / 2 x 512MB) 667MHz DDR2 SDRAM UPGRADED FOR FREE TO 4GB
[b]Harddrive[/b] 500GB SATA 3.0Gb/s with NCQ
[b]Monitor[/b] Dell™ E228WFP 24" Widescreen Flat Panel Monitor
[b]Graphic Card[/b] 128MB ATI Radeon™ HD 2400 Pro
[b]Optical Device[/b] 16X Max DVD+/-RW Combination Drive with double layer write capability
all this for $1500 AU.
Dell Inspiron 530 Desktop

item.title: New computer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:216007”]Monitor
Dell™ E228WFP 24" Widescreen Flat Panel Monitor $299.99 (I suggest a 22" instead)[/quote]

I also suggest a 22", but specifically the Iiyama ProLite E2201W.

http://www.behardware.com/articles/689-2/22-inch-lcd-monitors-the-3rd-wave.html

I have it and it’s fantastic for gaming.

Read full topic

item.title: New computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That is a complete rip off, here I will show you how cheap this should be:

Processor
Intel® Core™2 Quad Processor Q6600 (2.4GHz, 1066FSB, 8MB) $200

Operating System
Windows Vista Home Premium $99.99 (but I won’t include this in the price, I suggest downloading it if you must, otherwise Kubuntu)

Memory
4GB (2 x 2GB) 667MHz DDR2 SDRAM $72.99

Harddrive
500GB SATA 3.0Gb/s with NCQ $74.99

Monitor
Dell™ E228WFP 24" Widescreen Flat Panel Monitor $299.99 (I suggest a 22" instead)

Graphic Card
128MB256MB ATI Radeon™ HD 2400 Pro $18.99 (I recommend getting a better one, and nvidia over ATI)

Optical Device
16X20X Max DVD+/-RW Combination Drive with double layer write capability $22.99

Add on:

Motherboard
PC CHIPS P53G LGA 775 VIA P4M900CD Micro ATX Intel Motherboard $29.99

Case
Linkworld 3230-18 c2228u Black Steel ATX Mid Tower Computer Case 430W Power Supply $24.99

Total: $769.92 (google says 803.34 AUS)

Read full topic

item.title: New computer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:10, topic:216007”][quote author=ZeroFreeze link=topic=283882.msg2304109#msg2304109 date=1214761854]

The memory isn’t fantastic and what’s up with only 128mb gfx memory?

Holy shit, you call 3gb not fantastic? I’m still freaking stuck with 512mb ram, 64mb ATI Radeon GFX and a 2.4 Ghz processor.
[/quote]

667MhZ isn’t fantastic memory, and if it’s made by Dell it wont be brilliant quality either.[/quote]

That’s exactly what I mean.

Read full topic

item.title: New computer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:9, topic:216007”][quote author=Niall link=topic=283882.msg2303252#msg2303252 date=1214715740]
The memory isn’t fantastic and what’s up with only 128mb gfx memory?
[/quote]
Holy shit, you call 3gb not fantastic? I’m still freaking stuck with 512mb ram, 64mb ATI Radeon GFX and a 2.4 Ghz processor.[/quote]

667MhZ isn’t fantastic memory, and if it’s made by Dell it wont be brilliant quality either.

Read full topic

item.title: New computer

item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

The memory isn’t fantastic and what’s up with only 128mb gfx memory?

Holy shit, you call 3gb not fantastic? I’m still freaking stuck with 512mb ram, 64mb ATI Radeon GFX and a 2.4 Ghz processor.
